fields.description:
h3. Summary of bug

If the feedback module is disabled, then when the user creates an issue in the planning mode of the board, there will be an error

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Disable the feedback module of GreenHopper
# Access a Scrum board, and use the Plan mode
# Create an issue
# Issue will be created, but with the following error message :

!feedback bug.png|thumbnail!

h3. Additional Findings

* Problem does not occur when in Work or Report mode
* Problem does not occur when creating issues in JIRA
* Problem does not occur if the Feedback module is enabled
fields.summary: Error when creating issue in plan mode when Feedback is disabled

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
All of the values below will need to be grouped by instance:

- how many instances are actually activated (measurement: for every instance with GH enabled, make sure we store first visit to an instance - most likely to be /secure/Dashboard.jspa, which is in JIRA) 

- of these instances, how many find Rapid Boards (measurement: first visit to /secure/RapidStart.jspa in an instance) + how many of the ones without GH at first had them (this necessary to have the numbers right for the following points)
 -- Event is "gh.welcome.show"

- how many attempt to create a project? (measurement: opening of the dialogue to create a project)
 -- Event: "gh.welcome.create.project.start" with type in "label" field

- how many create a project + how many create a project of each type (scrum, kanban, diy) + how many create sample/non-sample projects? (measurement: store project_created as an event, with type associated to it, as well as if it was a sample project).
 -- Event: "gh.welcome.create.project.sampleData" with type in "label" field preceding the next event in case of simple data is used
 -- Event: "gh.welcome.create.project.complete" with type in "label" field

- how many non-sample projects create a single issue (measurement: store issue_created event)
 -- Event: "gh.issue.created" with keys array stringified in "keys" field

- of scrum non-sample users, how many create a sprint (measurement: sprint_created event)
 -- Event: "gh.rapidboard.sprint.backlog.addmarker"

- of scrum non-sample users, how many start a sprint (measurement: sprint_started event)
 -- Event: "gh.start.sprint.dialog.change.start" when attempt to start the sprint
 -- Event: "gh.start.sprint.dialog.change.complete" when they actually start it

+

- how many users use rapid boards exclusively, how many use a mix, how many use classic exclusively - the first and last is what we cannot determine at the moment (measurement: store requests to RapidBoard.jspa vs the other two classic boards, then count these per week grouping by instance). Note that this is actual usage grouped instance, as opposed to usage overall (so larger instances having more influence) or binary on/off "has ever used a classic/rapid board"
 -- Event: "gh.rapidboard.show" on view of rapid board
 -- Event: "gh.classic.show" on view of classic board


From Jay:

- How many epics appear on a board
 -- Event "gh.rapidboard.epics" with "value" field as count

- How many versions appear on a board
 -- TBD

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: What if 1 action triggers more than 1 event?
A: (/) It could and probably will - its up to the post-processing to effectively filter, order & group the events.
fields.summary: Add Atlassian Analytics events to GH

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Steps to replicate:

# Go to the plan mode of a board
# Enable two quick filters (such as 'Only My Issues' and 'Recently Updated')
# Create an issue
# Click into the first of the two issues so that it shows in the preview plane
# Click the cog on the issue and select more actions
# Enter 'convert to sub-task'
# Go through the wizard and convert the issue to a sub-task and finally hit finish.

h3. Result: 

The URI will become 'https://instance.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=2&view=planning&quickFilter=3&quickFilter=3' and only one of the QuickFilters will be selected

If you have three filters selected then the quickfilter parameter will repeat 3 times. If you go tick the quickfilters again and then convert another issue to a sub-task then you'll end up with even more quickfilters in the URI. Eventually this will cause an error as the number of filters will cause the URI to become too long and the page will not load.

h3. Expected result:

The URI should read 'https://instance.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=2&view=planning&quickFilter=3&quickFilter=4' and both of the quick filters will be selected.

h3. Workaround:

You will need to click on the quick filter that is repeated enough times to stop the repeating.
fields.summary: quickFilter repeats in URI when leaving and returning to board when multiple filters are selected

fields.description:
As a Scrum Master, I'd like to be able to store Sprint information in a custom field, a label or a tag. It would be independent of the work being done on the Issues, and only linked to the Sprint as a whole. I would also like to add attachments to Sprints.

+*Use case example:+*
- Defining a Spring goal.
- Sprint status is determined by the team based on business circumstances. E.g. a planned Sprint can be awaiting approval and ready for development, and one in progress can be progressing or being interrupted. It would be handy to have that information visible on the Board.
- Mockups for Sprint goals need to be attached on a Sprint level.


//

Incorporates the duplicated issue GHS-5396 {{As a Scrum user I can set a sprint goal so that I am reminded of the sprint's intention throughout}}
fields.summary: Ability to save Sprint goal and/or other properties in a separate field or tag

When a Story that was in some closed sprints (or active sprint) is cloned, the cloned story would retain the values of the Sprint field (even for the closed sprints).

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Story in a Scrum Board
# Place the story in a sprint
# Complete the sprint
# Clone the Story
# The cloned story will still retain the values of the Sprint field

As a user, looking at a scrum board, I would like a quick filter to show me all stories and all sub-tasks thereof IF I am assigned to either the story or ANY of the sub-tasks.

This would show more than just "my Issues". All that shows me is what I'm assigned to. Helpful sometimes, but it doesn't give me a context.

fields.description:
Epic tags not showing up in Rapid Plan board (scrum) if Epic not member of Project

Steps to reproduce:

Create Epic belonging to one project.
Create Story belonging to second project.

Create Scrum Planning board which included both projects.
Create two more planning boards which only contains one project each.

In the planning board with both projects, drag and drop Story belonging to second project into Epic belonging to first project.

See Epic tag in Backlog of Multi project board (as expected).

Do not see Story in Backlog of Project with Epic (this is not the bug but (IMHO) to be expected).

You do see the Story in the Backlot of Project which the story belongs to (also as expected), but you do not see the Epic Tag showing you the Epic Title.
In the screenshot you can see the tag shown in the Detail View, but not in the Backlog column.

Thanks!
Rick
fields.summary: Epic tags not showing up in Rapid Plan board (backlog) (SCRUM/Kanban) if Epic not member of Project

Steps to reproduce:

* Create a board including at least 2 projects (PROJECT A, PROJECT B)
* Create a sprint and add issues from both projects to it
* Make a copy of the board (the sprint will be copied too)
* Create a new filter to exclude PROJECT A from the new board 
* Create a new filter to exclude PROJECT B from the original board 
* Try to complete the sprint on one of the boards, you will notice the sprint on the other board is also completed. Sprints should behave independently.

fields.description:
robots.txt does not disallow RankBottom/RankTop URLs and causes Google Search Engine Robot to perform GET Request

Quoted from a customer:

Our site is being indexed by an internal Google Search Appliance to allow for corporate wide searching of data on a Google like web site. This works fine. However we have discovered a bug in Jira.

The robot will eventually crawl the URL /secure/RankBottom.jspa?issueId=731327  (take any issueId) and will perform a GET request. We can clearly see this in the web log:

{noformat}
10.16.44.43 - - [22/Jan/2013:02:00:00 +0100] "GET /browse/CR-2301 HTTP/1.0" 302 - "-" "gsa-crawler (Enterprise; T3-DU2NDCX3QWWQG; scott.morrell@non.verigy.com,ken.ramey@non.verigy.com,jim.osborne@non.verigy.com)"
10.16.44.43 - - [22/Jan/2013:02:00:00 +0100] "GET /robots.txt HTTP/1.0" 200 457 "-" "gsa-crawler (Enterprise; T3-DU2NDCX3QWWQG; scott.morrell@non.verigy.com,ken.ramey@non.verigy.com,jim.osborne@non.verigy.com)"
10.16.44.43 - - [22/Jan/2013:02:00:00 +0100] "GET /robots.txt HTTP/1.0" 200 457 "-" "gsa-crawler (Enterprise; T3-DU2NDCX3QWWQG; scott.morrell@non.verigy.com,ken.ramey@non.verigy.com,jim.osborne@non.verigy.com)"
10.16.44.43 - - [22/Jan/2013:02:00:00 +0100] "GET /robots.txt HTTP/1.0" 200 457 "-" "gsa-crawler (Enterprise; T3-DU2NDCX3QWWQG; scott.morrell@non.verigy.com,ken.ramey@non.verigy.com,jim.osborne@non.verigy.com)"
10.16.44.43 - - [22/Jan/2013:02:00:00 +0100] "GET /browse/CR-2301 HTTP/1.0" 302 - "-" "gsa-crawler (Enterprise; T3-DU2NDCX3QWWQG; scott.morrell@non.verigy.com,ken.ramey@non.verigy.com,jim.osborne@non.verigy.com)"
10.16.44.43 - - [22/Jan/2013:02:00:00 +0100] "GET /robots.txt HTTP/1.0" 200 457 "-" "gsa-crawler (Enterprise; T3-DU2NDCX3QWWQG; scott.morrell@non.verigy.com,ken.ramey@non.verigy.com,jim.osborne@non.verigy.com)"
10.110.10.45 - - [22/Jan/2013:01:59:59 +0100] "GET /browse/CR-77242 HTTP/1.0" 200 65150 "-" "Mozilla%2F5.0%20%28Macintosh%3B%20U%3B%20Linux%20i686%3B%20en-US%3B%20rv%3A1.8%29%20Gecko%2F20051111%20Firefox%2F1.5%20GSA%2F1 (Enterprise; T3-KT3WUATTQWSQY; ken.ramey@ptn.advantest.com)"
10.16.44.43 - - [22/Jan/2013:02:00:00 +0100] "GET /secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&mode=hide&jqlQuery=project+%3D+TEST72+AND+fixVersion+%3D+%227.2.0.1-FV2i%22+AND+resolution+in+(Fixed%2C+%22Will+not+fix%22%2C+Duplicate%2C+%22Cannot+Reproduce%22%2C+%22User+%2F+Usage+Error%22%2C+%22Fixed+-+no+code+change%22%2C+Done%2C+%22Device+issue+%2F+Test+Case+issue%22%2C+%22Fixed+by+other+CR%22%2C+Incomplete) HTTP/1.0" 200 29221 "-" "gsa-crawler (Enterprise; T3-DU2NDCX3QWWQG; scott.morrell@non.verigy.com,ken.ramey@non.verigy.com,jim.osborne@non.verigy.com)"
10.16.43.21 - - [22/Jan/2013:02:00:00 +0100] "GET /secure/RankBottom.jspa?issueId=665852 HTTP/1.0" 404 3272 "-" "Mozilla%2F5.0%20%28Macintosh%3B%20U%3B%20Linux%20i686%3B%20en-US%3B%20rv%3A1.8%29%20Gecko%2F20051111%20Firefox%2F1.5%20GSA%2F1 (Enterprise; T2-FYN8SNNZFNWJB; ken.ramey@non.verigy.com)"
10.16.43.21 - - [22/Jan/2013:02:00:00 +0100] "GET /secure/RankTop.jspa?issueId=632961 HTTP/1.0" 404 3269 "-" "Mozilla%2F5.0%20%28Macintosh%3B%20U%3B%20Linux%20i686%3B%20en-US%3B%20rv%3A1.8%29%20Gecko%2F20051111%20Firefox%2F1.5%20GSA%2F1 (Enterprise; T2-FYN8SNNZFNWJB; ken.ramey@non.verigy.com)"
10.16.44.43 - - [22/Jan/2013:02:00:00 +0100] "GET /secure HTTP/1.0" 302 - "-" "gsa-crawler (Enterprise; T3-DU2NDCX3QWWQG; scott.morrell@non.verigy.com,ken.ramey@non.verigy.com,jim.osborne@non.verigy.com)"
{noformat}

However the robots.txt file delivered with Jira does not "Disallow" the RankBottom / RankTop URLs. This has lead to issue corruption in one of our projects as the Google Searcher tried to "click" rank up / down.

This violates the HTTP standard. AFAIK the standard says that GET requests may not alter data.

Below is the robots.txt included with Jira:

{noformat}
# robots.txt for JIRA
# You may specify URLs in this file that will not be crawled by search engines (Google, MSN, etc)
#
# By default, all SearchRequestViews in the IssueNavigator (e.g.: Word, XML, RSS, etc) and all IssueViews
# (XML, Printable and Word) are excluded by the /sr/ and /si/ directives below.

User-agent: *
Disallow: /sr/
Disallow: /si/
Disallow: /charts
Disallow: /secure/ConfigureReport.jspa
Disallow: /secure/ConfigureReport!default.jspa
{noformat}
fields.summary: RankBottom/RankTop should be POSTs not GETs

fields.summary: Update GreenHopper to correctly work with JIRA 6.0 rename feature

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
A request for a feature to allow multiple owners for Rapid Boards.

*Workaround*

Create a shared jira user for each project team. This user's credentials are shared within the team, and then we create GH boards and jira filters with these shared users. If anyone wants to update a jira filter or GH board, they just login with the shared user and change it.
fields.summary: Multiple Owners for Rapid Boards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Update Epic Report screenshot on View Available Reports page

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Introduction:*
We are filtering our backlogs across projects using a customfield called sprint team. Our filters for each board filter for a single team only. Therefore if you change the sprint team for an issue, it disappears from the backlog. Unfortunately it also disappears from all reports!

*Example:*
Team Rocket has issue ABC-123 in their active sprint. Halfway through the sprint, they realize that they need help from another team and remove ABC-123 from their active sprint. The report shows correctly that ABC-123 was removed from the sprint's scope. After "assigning" ABC-123 to team Balloon, it disappears from their backlog but also from all of team Rocket's reports.

*Expected behavior:*
The issue has to show up in team Rocket's sprint report even though it is no longer in their backlog. Otherwise it is impossible to see that it was removed from the scope halfway through their sprint.
fields.summary: Issue disappears from all reports

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As of now, Kanban boards don't display Issue estimates on cards. It would be expected, though, that users can:
- display a selected estimate field on the Board (be it Time Estimates, Story Points or any other available);
- log time and see estimated and remaining time if they're using Time Estimates.

+Use case:+ prioritization of work on the fly; better overview of work in progress.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to make estimates visible on cards in Kanban board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When inserting new issues into the kanban board, they automatically move to the bottom of the board. It would be nice to be able to insert issues above or below another issue rather than having to insert it and then move it. This functionality previously existed in the classic planning and task board.
fields.summary: Insert new issue in kanban board based on rank of another issue

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: This issue is originally created in JIRA (JRA) project and moved to GreenHopper (GHS). Any request to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-31392 will lead that automatically to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-7262
fields.summary: Test Issue To Demonstrate Issue Move

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, you have to go to Configure for the board to switch the swimlane option to assignee, query, story on non swimlane option. It would be great if we can have a feature on the Work view of the new Rapid Boards to easily switch back and forth between the different swimlane options.

I don't want to create another board to switch between two swimlane types. I want to be able to switch in the work view on one board; otherwise, it will force me to create quick filters for what I want to do like for all assignees and then have the swimlane use the query option.
fields.summary: As a user I want to be able to easily switch between swimlanes within the Work Board View

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a team lead, I would like to enter the total team capacity for a sprint (the number of hours they have in total to work during the course of the sprint) and then see a line on the burndown that shows REMAINING TEAM CAPACITY based on total original time minus time logged on issues.

It's great that I can see the how much WORK is left, but I need to be able to compare it to how much TIME the team still has available to them.
fields.summary: Capacity line in burndown

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
For some customer that has more than 300 issues in the backlog, it would be hard to deal with all the issues where you have to scroll down to no ends. It would be really great if we can configure the maximum of issues per page on the backlog or not to have the page at all. This would be a great improvement to the current Rapid board, as you might know, this paging feature has been introduced in Classic board yet it seems not being implemented in the new Rapid board. Certain customer uses this feature and expect this to be available in the new Rapid board as well.

The page numbering should be put on top and bottom of the backlog for easier access of handling all the issues in the backlog. As an example, the following
!page3.PNG!
fields.summary: As a Rapid board user, paging feature on backlog should be implemented

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi there,

We organise our work items into JIRA projects then setup EPIC/STORY/TASK issues as required. 

In the GH planning view we get a full list of all the EPICS that are created across all the projects that are of interest to us.  We can then click on an epic and filter the backlog accordingly.  We then decide what project(s) we are to work on in the active sprint and move stories to it.

What is missing is a simple (and human readable) way of identifying which project a particular epic belongs too. One solution is to mandate that each epic has to include in its name the JIRA project ID - not ideal.

Any chance of an extension to the EPIC side panel that aggregates epics into a collapsible list of projects?  Then we can expand/show/hode only projects that are of interest in that time box and plan the applicable stories?

Thanks
fields.summary: In GH scrum planning view, show the project in the epic list

fields.description:
The sub-task panel has a 'Create' button to create sub-tasks quickly for an issue. It would be good to have a similar mechanism when viewing an epic, so that you can create issues for the epic.

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: How does this overwrite the current project and issuetype selection of the create issue dialog?
A: (/) No overriding is done for the create issue dialog. It behaves identical to the normal dialog. 

Q: What happens if you open the create issue for epic and create issue dialogs one after the other?
A: (/) Multiple issue creation is supported. After all issues are created and dialog is closed, then the created issues are associated with the epic

Q: What if the epic is closed?
A: (/) Issues will still be able to be associated to the epic.

Q: What if the epic doesn't exist anymore?
A: (/) An error message is shown saying the issue does not exist

Q: What if the epic has been changed to another issuetype?
A: (/) If the user is on the epic's view issue page and the epic's type is changed on another page, then creating issues in the epic work, but the association will fail with an error message saying the Issue should be of type Epic

Q: What if you have inline edits open in jira before clicking the button?
A: (/) They are closed before the dialog opens
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to create an issue inside an epic when viewing an epic in JIRA

fields.description:
While planning a new sprint I am able to see how much work is planned for the sprint in the summary row (section) below the sprint backlog. In this section I can see the amount of remaining work (estimate). This is essential for the proper planning of the sprint. We combine this with a Quick filters by Assignee in order to allow proper planning of the individual tasks.

However, once the sprint is is started, if you go to the Plan mode, you are not able to see the estimates summary row (section) below the sprint anymore. This is inconvenient as this it is hard to tell how much work is remaining - if you want to slice the work by some other criteria (besides status - statistic for which is available in the top-right corner of the sprint). 
What is needed is one of the following:
# Keep the estimates summary row (Section) below the sprint - for the started and for the not yet started sprints - the estimates summary should reflect the applied Quick Filters (as for the not started sprints), or
# Update the sprint estimate statistics (on the top-right) corner according to the selected Quick Filters.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to be able to see the remaining estimate summary in Plan mode for the started Sprint

fields.description:
Feature Request:
I'd like to be able to more easily track work hour estimates and logged work based on individual assignees. Currently we track hour estimates on sub-tasks within stories while stories are estimated with story points. Two related enhancements to the Agile Planning Board would make it easier to determine which team members have their time fully spoken for when planning the upcoming sprint. I know not all teams track hours, so the vissibility of these displays might need to be configurable.

1) On the Issue Details section (when an Issue is selected on the planning view of the Agile Board) show something similar to the "Time Tracking" section of the JIRA Issue page except broken out by sub-task assignee. This would show you at a glance who needs to work on this issue and how much work needs to be done by each person (because not all stories require the whole team).

2) For each Sprint (and the area above the Sprint Marker before starting a new one) show an aggregate "Time Tracking" section that breaks down hour estimates/logged for each assignee. This would show you at a glance how much each person has committed to for the sprint.
fields.summary: Add Time Tracking to the Agile Board Sprint Plan View

fields.description:
When ranking an issue to top via the *Rank To Top* button in Issue Screen, if the issue is in the backlog and there is an Inactive Sprint created, the issue will be automatically placed into the Inactive Sprint. It will not be moved to the top of the backlog as it should be. If there are multiple inactive sprints, then it will be placed into the top-most inactive sprint.

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a new Sprint. Don't start it.
# Go to any Jira issue that is currently not at the top of the backlog.
# Press "More Actions" -> "Rank to Top"
# Go to a Scrum-Board. Press "Plan" and you see that the Task went right into the topmost inactive sprint.
fields.summary: Rank To Top button via Issue Screen causes issue to automatically be moved from backlog into inactive sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In current implementation of GreenHopper, a single Epic can support multiple projects as needed. This means that only a single Epic issue type is used for all boards available by default. And due to this configurations, users are not able to create a new Epic issue type, and have different boards to use different Epic. 

It will be great if GreenHopper allows users to create multiple Epic issue type, and configure the available boards to use specific Epic issue type as required. 

Sample use case:
{quote}
In our (and most likely other users) case we have a combination of hardware and software projects. The two project streams are loosely coupled. For the hardware side, the use of the word "Epic" would not feel really natural. Example: 2 Volts power rise within 10 nanoseconds is not an "Epic", it is a "Feature". On the other hand the software that drives the instrument can use the "Epic" terminology. Example: "Device drivers support power-on sequence and self-test of high-speed power card".

Therefore I think it would be great if one could specify per configured board (Kanban or Scrum) which issue type should be considered the "Top Level Hierarchy".
{quote}
fields.summary: Add the ability to create multiple Epic issue type in JIRA Software
